author: Dmitri Safine [DDAY]
title: Indigenous Art Authenticity
description: COVID pandemic pushed indigenous artists to sell online. Ensuring authenticity of indigenous goods sold online is crucial to their survival.

assessments.note: The proposal is requesting funds to integrate their current marketplace to Cardano. With no real metrics or developer resources identified its hard to fully assess how much impact this app will have.
this proposal focuses on bringing real value to the world that happens to be based on Cardano, a great way to convert and retain users.
NFTs are the things which will boost any blockchain ecosystem, this project effectively addresses the dapp challenge in that prospective.

You raise an important point and aim at solving it practicaly + you have an already existing team onboard. However, i cannot give you 5 stars, for one reason: the scalability of the solution. So far, as i understand it, you are focused on NA indigenous communities which seems logical since you are based in Canada. However how do you plan, if your marketplace launched on Cardano, to onboard other communities and what are your criteria for "selecting" a community ?
yes seems to be well thought out with a highly motivated and qualified team
the project roadmap section is not at all specific to Plutus smart contract development and its unclear who on their team has the Haskell skills needed to build a Plutus dApp
The project team shared detailed information on their skills to boost credibility, provided proof of concepts, provided a detailed plan with a clear budget.
the team behind this proposal seems to have a good vision and a good team to pull this project, and there is high chances that this project will be implemented successfully.

This is your strongest point. You have a team already working on it. Thus you have the experience associated with this buisness. The plan is laid out clearly and the funds and their use too. Since you state this only part of the project, i would have liked to have some idea of what will be the next phases (Will you apply for another fund round ? and so on.) Also you are actively participating in NFT-DAO wouldn't there be a conflict in code or problems to implement it on cardano blockchain (this is maybe my fault since i dont understand all the intricacies and technicalities behind it).
yes high degree of clarity for the mission and its vision as a whole
This proposal is lacking a complete project plan, metrics to current user flow or the technical detail a CA needs to assert this effectively meets the challenge.

While the entire project is extremely customer focused, some metrics that address the amount of users expected to onboard into cardano would improve the rating. This could include the estimations on number of creators and consumers that could use the platform in the near future.
except break up of the required fund and timelines for the deliverables this project have provided sufficient information to asses the feasibility of the project.

I gave you 4 stars because you do describe in detail what you're trying to accomplish and how this solves a pain point for a community. But you do not give KPI as to measure the success of your proposal + a timeline would be welcomed. So maybe add some time sensitive detail as to when you think your project and what metrics will you use to gauge the advencement and success of the project. Finally maybe point out to the repository on which you'll publish your code since it will be open-source

solution: Convert IndigeneArts.com to be a niche NFT marketplace featuring indigenous art, certified by digital certificates of authenticity.
experience:
unCommonThread.biz team has built a successful IndigeneArts.com marketplace featured in Forbes.
